file_content.text: We shouldn't be seen speaking to each other. It isn't safe.
Good luck.
Are you Girr Antoc?
Yes. And you are the one I've been waiting for.
I am honored, of course, to help you in this transition. But I must admit that I'm also slightly confused.
From what little information I could gather, you've served the Empire quite well. Why change sides?
I've grown tired of the petty fools who call themselves Sith. I will join you in destroying them.
The Sith are too weak.
I... see. That isn't the usual explanation.
My fellow Sith are hunting me for the secret knowledge I possess. I need to escape.
I was betrayed!
Secret knowledge? That's very interesting. The Republic would certainly never betray you in such a way.
Imperials and Sith think they're better than everyone. I'm tired of it.
I'm sick of the Imps.
Yes, they are quite certain of their own superiority, aren't they?
I've seen how Republic people live. That's the life I want.
I want your way of life.
Of course. It must seem very appealing compared to the overbearing lifestyle that's been forced on you.
Lots of credits.
I'm in it for the credits.
Oh. I... didn't realize you had already discussed financial compensation.
Don't question me.
I'm sorry if my question upsets you. That isn't my intent.
You must understand my concern at your motives. This is a time of war, after all--we need to know who we can trust.
You can trust me.
I certainly hope so.
Who you trust is your concern.
Most defectors would be trying a bit harder to prove that their intent is genuine.
You fear me, don't you?
I do not think it is unreasonable to be cautious, given the circumstances.
You've met with me--that is the first step. You'll be contacted in the future with a location to surrender yourself.
You should go now, before anyone sees us speaking. Good luck to you.
I'm busy.
